statements: SELECT * FROM users;
SELECT user_id, username, role FROM users ORDER BY role DESC;
SELECT * FROM users WHERE role = 'admin';
SELECT username, password FROM users WHERE user_id = 1;
SELECT COUNT(*) FROM users;

SELECT user_id, username FROM users WHERE user_id IN (1, 2, 3);
SELECT username, role FROM users WHERE role = 'guest' ORDER BY username DESC;
SELECT * FROM users WHERE username LIKE '%john%' AND password = 'password123';
SELECT user_id, username, role FROM users WHERE user_id > 100 ORDER BY user_id ASC, role DESC;

SELECT username, role FROM users WHERE user_id = 3;
SELECT DISTINCT role FROM users;

SELECT users.username, roles.role_name FROM users JOIN user_roles ON users.user_id = user_roles.user_id JOIN roles ON user_roles.role_id = roles.role_id;

SELECT r.role_name, p.permission_name FROM roles r JOIN role_permissions rp ON r.role_id = rp.role_id JOIN permissions p ON rp.permission_id = p.permission_id;

SELECT username, role FROM Users JOIN Roles ON Users.role = Roles.role_name;

SELECT * FROM Users;

SELECT Users.username, Roles.role_name FROM Users JOIN UserRoles ON Users.user_id = UserRoles.user_id JOIN Roles ON UserRoles.role_id = Roles.role_id;

SELECT Users.username, Permissions.permission_name FROM Users JOIN UserRoles ON Users.user_id = UserRoles.user_id JOIN Roles ON UserRoles.role_id = Roles.role_id JOIN RolePermissions ON Roles.role_id = RolePermissions.role_id JOIN Permissions ON RolePermissions.permission_id = Permissions.permission_id;
